de.esoco.ewt.layout

Class FluentCssLayout<L extends FluentCssLayout<L>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.layout.GenericLayout
      • de.esoco.ewt.layout.FluentCssLayout<L>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<L>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexLayout, GridLayout

    public abstract class FluentCssLayout<L extends FluentCssLayout<L>>
extends GenericLayout
implements de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<L>
    A base class for CSS-based layouts that implement a fluent interface for the layout configuration. Subclasses must implement the method applyLayoutStyle(StyleData, Style) and typically also addWidget(HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget, StyleData, int) to set the style that are CSS speci

      Creates a new instance.

      Adds a certain widget to a widget container according to this layout and the given style data.
      protected abstract void applyLayoutStyle(StyleData rStyleData, com.google.gwt.dom.client.Style rStyle)
      Must be implemented to apply the CSS properties for the layout parameters to the style of the layout container.
      protected abstract void applyWidgetStyle(StyleData rStyleData, com.google.gwt.dom.client.Style rStyle)
      Must be implemented to apply the CSS layout properties for a widget when it is added by addWidget(HasWidgets, Widget, StyleData, int).
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets createLayoutContainer(Container rContainer, StyleData rStyleData)
      Creates a new GWT container widget that represents this layout.

    • Method Detail

      • addWidget

        public void addWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets rContainer,
                      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget rWidget,
                      StyleData rStyleData,
                      int nIndex)
        Adds a certain widget to a widget container according to this layout and the given style data. This default implementation ignores the style data and either invokes HasWidgets.remove(Widget) or, depending on the index and container type, InsertPanel.insert(Widget, int). Subclasses may override this method to implement a different layout strategy.
        Overrides:
        addWidget in class GenericLayout
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to add the widget to
        rWidget - The widget to add
        rStyleData - The style defining the layout position of the widget
        nIndex - The index to add the widget add (if supported by the implementation) or -1 to add as the last widget

      • createLayoutContainer

        public com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets createLayoutContainer(Container rContainer,
                                                                      StyleData rStyleData)
        Creates a new GWT container widget that represents this layout. This method is only intended to be used internally by the GEWT framework.
        Specified by:
        createLayoutContainer in class GenericLayout
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The GEWT container to create the widget for
        rStyleData - The style of the container widget
        Returns:
        A new widget container

      • applyLayoutStyle

        protected abstract void applyLayoutStyle(StyleData rStyleData,
                                         com.google.gwt.dom.client.Style rStyle)
        Must be implemented to apply the CSS properties for the layout parameters to the style of the layout container.
        Parameters:
        rStyleData - The style data of the EWT container
        rStyle - The style of the layout container

      • applyWidgetStyle

        protected abstract void applyWidgetStyle(StyleData rStyleData,
                                         com.google.gwt.dom.client.Style rStyle)
        Must be implemented to apply the CSS layout properties for a widget when it is added by addWidget(HasWidgets, Widget, StyleData, int).
        Parameters:
        rStyleData - The style data of the EWT component
        rStyle - The target style to set the layout properties on
